paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants N588D and N588K, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.
Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.

functional_data.summary: The N588D substitution results in protein variants that suppress proper IKr channel function.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: N588D mutation is associated with Long QT syndrome.
key_quotes: The N588D and N588K substitutions in KCNH2 occur in the S5-Pore linker region and result in replacement of a polar Asparagine residue (N) with a negatively charged Aspartic Acid (D) or positively charged Lysine (K).
Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.
Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.

functional_data.summary: The N588K substitution results in protein variants that suppress proper IKr channel function.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: N588K mutation is associated with Short QT syndrome.
key_quotes: The N588D and N588K substitutions in KCNH2 occur in the S5-Pore linker region and result in replacement of a polar Asparagine residue (N) with a negatively charged Aspartic Acid (D) or positively charged Lysine (K).
Patients with these mutations are typically heterozygotes or compound heterozygotes.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
